alert.note: Alert for Brown (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 24 at 7:03PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of San Saba County through 745 PM CDT... At 702 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Mullin to near Sloan. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... San Saba, Richland Springs, Algerita, Cherokee, Skeeterville, Sloan, Harkeyville, Locker, Spring Creek and Us-190 Near The San Saba- Lampasas County Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for west central Texas.
